title: Drawing, "Design for Drapery, Possibly for Library", 1802
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of Mrs. John Innes Kane
description:
Horizontal rectangle. Design for the Royal Pavilion, Brighton. Design of a drapery for a recess opening. Drapery in blue caught at the center and upper corners with red bows and tassels. The central space is spanned by curtains, lacking central supports.

Original album associated with this collection still exists.  See 1948-40-1 accessory

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Design for Drapery, Possibly for Library", 1802.
1802. Watercolor on paper. Museum purchase through gift of Mrs. John Innes Kane. 1948-40-77.
